text: Nurpur Rajputan is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Nurpur Rajputan. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Nurpur Rajputan has total number of 78 houses and population of 442 of which include 239 males and 203 females. Literacy rate of Nurpur Rajputan is 68.00%, lower than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 42 which is 9.50% of total population of Nurpur Rajputan, and child sex ratio is approximately 826, lower than state average of 846. As per census 2011, 138 people were engaged in work activities out of the total population of Nurpur Rajputan which includes 129 males and 9 females. According to census survey report 2011, 97.10% workers describe their work as main work and 2.90% workers are involved in Marginal activity providing livelihood for less than 6 months. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
